titleStmt.title: Thomas L. Barret to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2179

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
VIRGIL McKNIGHT, PRES'T
THOMAS L. BARRET, CASHIER
BANK OF KENTUCKY,
LOUISVILLE, Sept 11th 1865.
Hon Thos E Bramlette Esq.,
Cashier
Frankfort
Ky.
Dear Sir:

We have but one Notary connected With this Bank and his health is so precarious that he is ofter unable to be on duty and much inconvienence is experienced for Want of a Notary May I therefore ask the Kindness of you to Commissioner Milton McKnight (who is one of our Clerks an son of our President) as Notary.

Your Early Compliance will oblige
Very truly
Your fiend &c
Thomas L. Barret
Cashier
Notary Public
Jefferson Co
Milton McKnight
apptd
12 Sept/65
